page.title: 10TADCASTER BY-PASS
page.content:
Tadcaster was until 1978 an extremely congested town , especially in summer when traffic from Leeds and surrounding areas was on its way to the Yorkshire Coast.
A by-pass for Tadcaster was first mentioned during the 1930's but no plans were published until 1972. There were two public inquiries to consider various routes and to hear objections and a final decision on the road was not made until early 1975. Construction work started in 1976 and two years later in August 1978 the by-pass was opened. The cost of the road was Â£8.5m.
